intro: Calosciadium latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf cowplant, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has compound leaves with broad, ovate leaflets. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Calosciadium latifolium is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
